block.p: ALPHARMA INC., Fort Lee, N.J., a maker of generic drugs, agreed to sell five million shares of its Class A stock to the Donaldson, Lufkin & Jenrette Securities Corp. for $186 million after fees and expenses.

TEXAS INSTRUMENTS INC., Dallas, whose semiconductors power two-thirds of the cellular telephones in the world, said it would spend $450 million to expand its plant in Freising, Germany, which would add about 300 jobs and double the manufacturing capacity at the factory.

ALPHARMA INC., Fort Lee, N.J., a maker of generic drugs, agreed to sell five million shares of its Class A stock to the Donaldson, Lufkin & Jenrette Securities Corp. for $186 million after fees and expenses.

TEXAS INSTRUMENTS INC., Dallas, whose semiconductors power two-thirds of the cellular telephones in the world, said it would spend $450 million to expand its plant in Freising, Germany, which would add about 300 jobs and double the manufacturing capacity at the factory.

INFONET SERVICES CORP., El Segundo, Calif., a provider of Internet access to businesses, agreed to allow Deutsche Telekom of Germany, the largest phone company in Europe, to resell its services worldwide for about $1 billion over three years.
LONMIN PLC., London, the fourth-largest mining company in England, sold its hotel and casino interests in the Bahamas to Driftwood Freeport Ltd. of Florida for $25 million in cash.
